title: Allegro Technical Consultant
content:
About Us Joining Capco means joining an organization that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognise that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can. We believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different. We are/have: • Experts in banking and payments, capital markets and wealth and asset management • Deep knowledge in financial services offering, including e.g. Finance, Risk and Compliance, Financial Crime, Core Banking etc. • Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there Focused on maintaining our nimble, agile and entrepreneurial culture
Location : Bangalore
Role : Allegro Technical Consultant
Exp : 4-7 years
JD/Skills

More than 3 years of experience with data management including proficiency with advanced SQL concepts (T-SQL, stored procedures, functions)
Must have experience of coding using C# for at least 2 to 4 years
More than 3 years of experience with .NET programming (including ASP.NET WebForms, DataSets, Web Services) 
2+ years of experience with SQL Server Reporting (SSRS)
Development of SQL scripts, stored procedures
Good understanding of development of data migration and data conversion SQL scripts
Participate in CTRM software implementations
Participate in the development or enhancement of technical training materials
Provide Allegro technical expertise for multiple commodities
Provide .NET programming services as needed
Communicate progress weekly with team leads or project managers
Work along with onshore support team to manage batch support of jobs feeding in data and delivering data to consumers
Allegro configuration (views, parameters, addition of fields and others as related to the specific functional areas)
Allegro extensions (class events)
Integration of Allegro with external systems
Must possess excellent debugging skills
Exposure to upgrades and enhancement projects by providing technical expertise and efforts. This includes creating extensions (class events, views, stored procedures), performing systems integrations, conducting data migration or conversion, class event upgrades and developing reports as applicable

WHY JOIN CAPCO? You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry. We offer: • A work culture focused on innovation and creating lasting value for our clients and employees • Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
